name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Downtown Vancouver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights beofre travelling back to Ireland and had a wonderful time. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a penthouse suite by a lovely front of house manager. The staff were extremely helpful and the location of the hotel was wonderful, Granville St is full of character and I liked the way it wasn't super touristy. The street may be a tiny bit run down but I always felt very safe - even as a woman walking on my own late at night. I would glady stay in the this hotel again as it was superb value for money!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel
Nice hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at this Best Western for one night before our cruise to Alaska. Although there have been several reviews that indicate that the area around the hotel is bad, we never felt unsafe. We did walk around the area in the evening and it was fine. You can easily avoid the bad areas listed by others. The hotel room was up to update and well kept. They actually had the best pillows of all the places we stayed for the following 2 weeks. Our room was on a higher floor and it had a view of the city and the tops of some mountains in the distance. The hotel offers a free shuttle drop off to the downtown area. You just call the front desk on the day that you need the shuttle to reserve a time. We used it the next morning to get to Canada Place where we boarded our cruise ship. The driver dropped us off directly where the cruise ship porters could immediately take our bags. Overall, this hotel was clean, comfortable, affordable for the downtown area. I would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: Clean, modern, comfortable -- iffy neighborhood
reviews.text: I'm originally from Vancouver, and even now I come back once every 1-2 years for a break from work. Vancouver really does deserve its reputation as one of the best places on earth to live. And even if I'm not a typical tourist going to all the typical tourist spots - I still love to come back, relax and wander around town. It's a perfect place just to chill out, and laze about - basically heaven for a slacker mall-rat like myself looking for some quiet down-time away from work.

My wife and I previously stayed at many hotels of all price ranges in all parts of Vancouver - but our previous favorite was the Meridien at 910 Beach. In many ways, that was an ideal place for us. Modern, clean rooms with every imaginable amenity for a couple or small family: fully equipped kitchen, laundry, spacious living rooms etc. It is perfectly appropriate to call it a home away from home if you're thinking about a week-long break (like we usually do). We particularly like their townhouse suites - which are outside the hotel 'proper' and even more like staying in your own home. It suits me more in that I feel more like a local Vancouverite and less like a tourist. The reason that we didn't stay there this time was because the Meridien does NOT have air conditioning. Yes, I know Vancouver is not known to be a warm city, but did anybody notice the temperatures here in early July this year rising to over 35 Celsius?! That's Global Warming for you all, folks. Sorry I'm not greener myself - but I do appreciate some air-con in this kind of weather.
reviews.title: Good location and base for sight seeing.

likes.disliked: — The expensive charge for internet use in the lobby $4 for 20 mins!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That's why we looked elsewhere. Our key requirements were: air-con, secure parking, convenient location, cleanliness, and preferably Internet access. I use the Internet when travelling with a small laptop to access all the wonderful online travel guides - so I never need to bring travel books and maps. And I use the hard-drive to store my digital photos. Oh yes, this time we were also travelling with our baby son -- so we definitely needed a kitchen or kitchenette. We needed this so we could clean our son's milk bottles out daily, and prepare pureed food for him. In this regard, the Meridien would have been ideal - but alas, no air-con ...
reviews.title: Handy for downtown

reviews.text: room was very cramped and not very modern, although clean. the air conditioning did not seem to work and there were no windows that could be opened. the location is great, right in downtown. the thing that turned us off was the service. front desk staff was very stoic and not very helpful. overall, just an average stay.
reviews.title: great location, but not the greatest stay

reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights in the Best Western Vancouver, it is a good location for checking out the city. The resturant beside it The White Spot is fine for breakfast and light snacks. The room was a average size and was clean. Staff at reception were helpfull, car parking charge of CAD10.00 per night.
